The frigate was named for Vice Admiral [[Joel Thompson Boone]], M.D. (1889–1974). FFG-28, the first U.S. ship to bear the admiral's name, was ordered 23 January 1978, [[Ship naming and launching|launched]] 16 January 1980 by [[Todd Pacific Shipyards]], and [[Ship commissioning|commissioned]] 15 May 1982. She has since earned numerous awards and commendations. The rudder fell off Mayport-based frigate USS Boone while on deployment in the western Mediterranean. The mishap forced the ship to send out a call for help to which Canadian destroyer [[HMCS Iroquois (DDG 280)|HMCS Iroquois]] responded, providing divers who inspected the ship's underside. Within 24 hours, Boone was being towed to [[Naval Station Rota Spain|Rota]] for repairs by the German Navy's replenishment oiler [[Rhön-class_tanker|Spessart]]. The ship was not adrift or totally dead in the water because its two 350-horsepower auxiliary propulsion units provided a “limited amount of maneuverability.” The lost rudder was replaced Dec. 27 and, after a day of operational testing, Boone got underway again Dec. 28.<ref>[http://www.seawaves.com/newsletters/TDIH/november/30nov] {{dead link|date=May 2013}}</ref> USS ''Boone'' was assigned to [[DESRON|Destroyer Squadron 14]] and was the recipient of the 2005 DESRON 14 [[Battle E|Battle "E"]]. On 16 February 2007, she was awarded the 2006 Battle "E" award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.navy.mil/search/display.asp?story_id=27895|title=Surface Force Ships, Crews Earn Battle "E"|publisher=U.S. Navy|date=2007-02-19|accessdate=2013-05-28}}</ref> ''Boone'' was homeported in [[Naval Station Mayport|Mayport, Florida]], and was a member of the [[United States Navy Reserve|Navy Reserve]]. In March 2010, she was assigned to the [[United States Fifth Fleet]] fighting [[Somali piracy]]. The last Commanding Officer of the USS Boone was LCDR Robert Speight.<ref>[http://www.boone.navy.mil/Site%20Pages/CO.aspx 'CO Bio]{{dead link|date=May 2013}}</ref> ''Boone'' decommissioned 23 February 2012. ==References== {{reflist}} {{NVR|http://www.nvr.navy.mil/nvrships/details/FFG28.htm}} ==External links== {{Commons cat|USS Boone (FFG-28)}} *[http://www.boone.navy.mil// USS ''Boone'' Official site] *[http://www.navsource.org/archives/07/0728.htm navsource.org: USS ''Boone''] *[http://www.navysite.de/ffg/FFG28.HTM navysite.de: USS ''Boone''] *[http://www.maritimequest.com/warship_directory/us_navy_pages/frigates/pages/boone_ffg_28_page_1.htm MaritimeQuest USS Boone FFG-28] ==Further reading== *{{cite book| author=Milton F.
